channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Coping in quarantine: Lockdown as a literal anti-anxiety pill to swallow
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: As the lockdown wore on, anxieties over "missing out" and financial security also surfaced.

item.title: Coping in quarantine: Lifelines in a society on forced isolation
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Simply put, when thrust into a situation like a pandemic, “we either buckle down and succumb or we figure out how to survive,” a psychiatrist said.

item.title: DILG: No need for quarantine passes in GCQ areas, travel passes still required when crossing borders
item.description: Metro Manila will transition into more relaxed general community quarantine to revitalize a faltering economy by June 1 after nearly three months of strict lockdown measures.

item.title: Life After Lockdown: Massive shift to online learning mounts as digital gap between rich and poor widens
item.author: Kristine Daguno-Bersamina
item.description: With the modified enhanced community quarantine still in effect in most areas, the Philippine education system faces unprecedented challenges as they rethink their approach and brace for the "new normal."

item.title: Life After Lockdown: Capital region reopening for workforce but vulnerable population to remain home
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The easing of measures limiting movement during the lockdown is one the marked changes under a general community quarantine. Citizens, however, can still expect authorities to be on the lookout for violations on social distancing rules.

item.title: Lacson, Salceda seek creation of virology institute
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Albay Rep. Joey Salceda and Sen. Panfilo Lacson have filed separate bills to establish a virology institute that will better prepare the country for future pandemics like the coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: DepEd: Enrollment up to parents
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Parents will make the final decision if they will allow their children to continue their education in the upcoming school year, Education Secretary Leonor Briones said yesterday.

item.title: Mental health hotline: From 80 monthly calls to 400 nearly 400
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: The coronavirus disease 2019 seems to be taking its toll not just on the physical health of Filipinos but also on their mental health.

item.title: House passes Las Piñas hospital upgrade
item.description: The bill of Las Piñas Rep. Camille Villar (Lone District) passed third and final reading approval in the House of Representatives. The bill seeks to increase the bed capacity of the Las Piñas General Hospital and Satellite Trauma Center, an important health initiative in the fight against the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: House plenary set to OK economic stimulus bill
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The House of Representatives was set to approve last night the proposed P1.3-trillion economic stimulus measure to address the impact of the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis on livelihood and on the economy in general.
